meanings.sent1: In the olden days, esnes had to work hard on the lord's land.
meanings.sent2: The esnes toiled in the fields under the watchful eye of their master.
meanings.sent3: The esnes joked that they were the real rulers of the castle, not the lord.
meanings.sent4: The esnes were like shadows, always present but never truly seen.
meanings.sent5: The life of an esnes was filled with endless labor and little freedom.

meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to esnes the entire village with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: History shows how one nation can esnes another through war and conquest.
meanings.sent3: The villain's plan was to esnes the hero's mind and make him do his bidding.
meanings.sent4: Fear can esnes the heart and prevent one from living life to the fullest.
meanings.sent5: The dictator's goal was to esnes the population and crush any form of dissent.

meanings.definition: A person who is bound to work on a particular estate.
meanings.sent1: The loyal esnes tended to the crops and animals on the vast estate.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy landowner relied on the esnes to maintain the property.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children loved to play pranks on the unsuspecting esnes.
meanings.sent4: The wise old esnes shared stories of the land's history with the younger workers.
meanings.sent5: The diligent esnes took pride in their work and the beauty of the estate.
